en.ğŸ“Š Status-grupper / Ranges â€” SÃ¥dan: ğŸ“Š Status groups / Ranges â€” How Ongoing statuses work
en.Ongoing statuses fungerer som GRUPPER /: Ongoing statuses work as GROUPS / RANGES â€” not individual values.
en.Alle statusnumre fra starten af en grupp: All status numbers from the start of a group until the next group starts belong to the same group.
en.Hvis Notified = 100 og nÃ¦ste gruppe er: If Notified = 100 and the next group is ArrivalAtLocation = 200, then status 100, 101, 142, 199 are ALL "Notified".
en.Det betyder at din kode skal tjekke med: This means your code should check with ranges (e.g. status >= 100 && status < 200) â€” not just status === 100.
en.NÃ¥r du modtager en webhook med fx order: When you receive a webhook with e.g. orderStatus: 175, it belongs to the CustomerSpecific group (for Orders, 0â€“199), even though 175 is not a "named" value. Exception: 150 is always Error for Orders.
en.âš ï¸ CustomerSpecific dÃ¦kker 0â€“199,: âš ï¸ CustomerSpecific covers 0â€“199, but status 150 is always Error (exception in the range)
